author: greta

text: Have you lost your mind? Tell me what law requires me to tell YOU what I think about anything. Maybe I have the decency not to share my opinions on everything and  thus stir up more debate than we need on any issue.  More energy should be focused on fixing problems than winning.

author: greta

author: greta

text: What is so weird about you tweet is it suggests that you just want to hear what you agree with..and if that is the case...what is the point of watching...like looking in a mirror? Where is the intellectual challenge of looking at yourself?
author: greta

text: Somehow I just don’t think you unfollowing me is going to destroy my life...if I only listened to people with whom I agreed and agreed all the time, I would be a pretty pathetic soul..
author: greta

text: Do you want me to go down the list of what others, including people you watch on tv have said or done? Or your politicians? Or maybe even you? I have never seen so many “perfect people” than on twitter...never cutting others slack when their own closet may be suspect.

text: I suspect redundant safety mechanisms are options..

author: greta

text: I said ‘literally’..I think it is a stretch to think he had been on the job long enough to be described for viewers as such..it gives a very incomplete description of his experience and could lead to over reliance that his opinion based on that post; issue:good journalism or not?
author: greta

text: It has been reported that they suspect he was disoriented..hence he should have relied on the instruments..
author: greta

text: Yes, training is important;I wonder about copilot on Ethiopia flight w/ only 200 hours and 200 hours on what type of plane? Piper cub? You need an experienced co pilot-esp when there is a crisis
author: greta

text: Slight stretch to say he is “Fmr WH Com Dir” - yes, literally correct but had the job for only 6 days (you can’t even get your govt identification card in 6 days!)
author: greta

text: Not necessarily..having added safety features even if unrelated to cause of actual crash is a good idea
author: greta

text: The plane was telling the pilot something else;This is the problem:when should pilot believe instruments and when should not?Note:JFK Jr. crash probably because he did NOT believe the instruments..in Lion Air would have been better to go on instincts, not instruments
author: greta

text: Do you agree more with ⁦@rpierry⁩ (below) or with me ? Issue is journalism and how we do our jobs...
author: greta

text: Don’t agree w/ you about timing of news reports...more pressure from media after the Lion Air crash may have caused Boeing to move faster w/ notice and software in the event that is also the cause of Ethiopia Air crash..and then? Maybe that plane may not have crashed...

text: I miss you ... I had a great time there but now on a new adventure  at GrayTV  and it is exciting for me..again building something new
author: greta

text: What a world...
author: greta

text: Gray TV owns about 145 broadcast news stations across USA - from Hawaii/Alaska to Iowa to South Carolina to Florida and in between ..you can get via your tv, via ROKU or stream
author: greta

text: No, not at all...I don’t wish anyone to lose a job and I like it when people get jobs..it was my reflection on what happens at ANY news org when there is a big corporate change.
author: greta

text: Fox asked me to stay..I had a good clause in my contract that let me leave mid contract;I feared that Fox would be chaotic when it had all those corp problems like CNN was in 2001 w/ AOL..so I decided to exercise the clause.
author: greta

text: I never suggested they would be gone...I said ‘often’ changes at networks are made when there is a big corporate change...typically (always?) any show making lots of money for a network is safe.
author: greta

text: might? Or will ?  or should ? :)
author: greta

text: BEST NEWS EVER! You and I both cheer for the Packers and you can watch my show when we launch it on @Roku
author: greta

text: Fox News is separating off from the rest ..it is not part of the Disney deal
author: greta

text: I had many great years there..traveled the world etc..but either cable has changed or I have changed (or both changed)...in any event, it became time to move on to other adventures..and I am really loving Gray TV
author: greta

text: It is better than cable or satellite - it is FREE (you have to pay for cable and satellite); Gray owns about 145 stations across USA from Alaska and Hawaii to South Carolina...Florida ..and in between
author: greta

text: It is part of the deal in that it will be separated from Disney and essentially a standalone
author: greta

text: Gray TV owns 145 or so stations all over USA - from Alaska to Hawaii to Iowa to Wisc to South Carolina to Florida and in between..and unlike cable, you can watch FREE (you don’t need to pay monthly cable fee)
author: greta

text: I will be there from time to time;Gray TV in Iowa (eg @KCRG and @kwqcnews )is ENORMOUSLY important in 2020 because of Iowa caucus;all the candidates will want to talk to these two stations because they reach the Iowa voters (not nec true w/ cable since people have dropped cable)
author: greta

text: Well...it is immoral to live in Wisconsin and not cheer for the Packers. :)
author: greta

text: It is exciting to have a change...I really like to learn and what is astounding to me is that I had no idea how different cable and broadcast (Gray TV) are...and as a consequence, I have much to learn and I like to learn
author: greta

text: No, and I did not mean to suggest that or start a rumor..I am very happy at Gray TV...I was just thinking about impact on a network when things change at the top
author: greta

text: I will let you know via twitter when the show gets launched (we are busy developing it)...one thing is for certain...you can see it streamed (more and more people are cutting the cable and relying on broadcast...roku etc.)
author: greta

text: I pretty much agree with this...I have fond memories of my time there but it became time to move on and I am really excited about my adventure w/ Gray TV
author: greta

text: When I get my show on Gray TV launched, come watch it!
author: greta

text: No, it won’t be me and I did not mean to start a rumor that it is..I was just thinking about how in TV news orgs, when new boss takes over,he/she wants to put a stamp on the org and that means change

author: greta

text: It depends on the business;some NDA are legit; eg coke wants to keep secret of course its recipe for coke..but what are news orgs hiding? A news org should be transparent - especially since it demands transparency of everyone else (but not itself.) It is called #hypocrisy

text: If you “know” what is in the Mueller report, you are drinking the kool aid of some network...the report is not out. Wait for the report, wait for the facts and get out of the echo chamber of whatever network you have been watching.
author: greta

text: What news orgs/anchors/reporters in the last 8 weeks have “reported” that the Mueller report would be out “next week” or “soon” etc. and well..that time has long passed without the report? And do those who report that ever apologize to viewer because the report is NOT yet out?
author: greta

text: I have no idea what the Mueller report will conclude (it is not out, I have not yet read it)—but if you listen to most on the news, you would think his report was already out as they sling all their unfounded remarks...
author: greta

text: Both political parties have their share of members who say stupid stuff, whether it be once or often or a mistake or taken out of context.....no party has a monopoly on this....

author: greta

text: I think it irresponsible for politicians or news people to tell us their conclusion of the Mueller investigation BEFORE Mueller has completed the investigation and given the American people his report..

text: I am highly suspicious of NDAs at news orgs - first they pay their anchors / reporters to talk...and then when they leave? They want to muzzle them...why? Hiding something?
